meanings.def: to obtain something by paying money for it
examples: buy (something) Where did you buy that dress?
She had no money to buy a ticket.
They can't afford to buy school books.
If you're thinking of getting a new car, now is a good time to buy.
buy something from somebody/something I bought it from a friend for £10.
buy something off somebody/something (informal) She bought it off eBay for $50.
buy somebody something He bought me a new coat.
buy something for somebody He bought a new coat for me.
buy something + adv./prep. I bought my car second-hand.
They buy all their groceries in bulk .
+ adv./prep. It's generally cheaper if you buy online.
They make their money by buying cheap and selling dear.
Some people buy all their groceries online.
I think he was motivated by his mother.
Don't let the opportunity pass you by.
Bye! See you later.
He bought a car for his daughter.
I bought it for $25.
I bought some books from a friend.
I can't afford to buy a new car.
Old bicycles can be bought quite cheaply.
She makes her living buying and selling antiques.
Was the produce imported or bought locally?
We can afford to buy enough paint to do the whole house.
Young people are very comfortable buying online.

meanings.def: to be enough to pay for something
examples: He gave his children the best education that money can buy.
Five pounds doesn't buy much nowadays.
There are some things money can't buy.

meanings.def: to persuade somebody to do something dishonest in return for money
examples: He can't be bought (= he's too honest to accept money in this way).

meanings.def: to obtain something by losing something else of great value
examples: Her fame was bought at the expense of her marriage.

meanings.def: to believe that something is true, especially something that is not very likely
examples: You could say you were ill but I don't think they'd buy it (= accept the explanation).
We make sure our clients get the best that money can buy.

meanings.def: to have been killed, especially in an accident or a war
examples: Joe finally bought it in a plane crash in Tunisia.

meanings.def: to get back a country's assets, such as land or property, after they have been owned by another country
examples: The prime minister revealed his plan to buy back the farm from foreign ownership.

meanings.def: to do something in order to delay an event, a decision, etc.
examples: The negotiators kept the gunman talking to buy time for the hostages.

meanings.def: if you buy a pig in a poke, you buy something without seeing it or knowing if it is good enough
examples: Buying from a catalogue can mean buying a pig in a poke.

meanings.def: to sell somebody something/to buy something that has no value or is worth much less than the price paid

idioms.idiom: the best that money can buy
examples: We make sure our clients get the best that money can buy.

idioms.def: to have been killed, especially in an accident or a war
examples: Joe finally bought it in a plane crash in Tunisia.

idioms.def: to get back a country's assets, such as land or property, after they have been owned by another country
examples: The prime minister revealed his plan to buy back the farm from foreign ownership.

examples: The negotiators kept the gunman talking to buy time for the hostages.

idioms.def: if you buy a pig in a poke, you buy something without seeing it or knowing if it is good enough
examples: Buying from a catalogue can mean buying a pig in a poke.

idioms.def: to sell somebody something/to buy something that has no value or is worth much less than the price paid

meanings.def: a thing that is worth the money that you pay for it
examples: That jacket was a really good buy.
Best buys this week are carrots and cabbages.

meanings.def: something that is bought or that is for sale; the act of buying something
examples: Computer games are a popular buy this Christmas.
The club has made some great buys this season (= it has bought good new players).
